001package Calibration_Demos;
002
003import java.awt.Color;
004import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.List;
007
008import ij.IJ;
009import ij.ImagePlus;
010import ij.gui.Line;
011import ij.gui.OvalRoi;
012import ij.gui.Overlay;
013import ij.gui.Roi;
014import ij.io.LogStream;
015import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
016import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.ZhangData;
017import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
018import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.ViewTransform;
019import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
020import imagingbook.lib.util.resource.ResourceLocation;
021
022
023/**
024 * This plugin projects opens an image stack containing the 5 Zhang
025 * test images, then outlines the positions of the observed image 
026 * points and finally projects the points of the calibration model
027 * using the calculated intrinsic camera parameters (same for all
028 * views) and the extrinsic parameters calculated for each view.
029 * All data are part of Zhang's demo data set that comes with the
030 * EasyCalib program. NO CALIBRATION is performed here!
031 * 
032 * Graphic elements are drawn as non-destructive vector overlays:
033 * BLUE circles: observed corner points (used for calibration).
034 * RED markers: projected model points (to validate parameters).
035 * - LOOK CLOSELY / ZOOM IN! 
036 * The complete stack with overlay can be saved as a TIFF file. 
037 * 
038 * @author W. Burger
039 * @version 2021-08-22
040 */
041public class Demo_Zhang_Projection_Overlay implements PlugIn {
042        
043        static Class<?> resourceRootClass = ZhangData.class;
044        static String resourceDir = "resources/";
045        static String resourceName = "CalibImageStack.tif";
046        
047        static double CircleRadius = 1.0;
048        static double CrossRadius  = 2.0;
049        static Color CircleColor = Color.blue;
050        static Color CrossColor = Color.red;
051        static double StrokeWidth  = 0.25;
052        
053        static boolean BeVerbose = false;
054        
055        static {
056                LogStream.redirectSystem();
057                PrintPrecision.set(6);
058        }
059        
060        public void run(String arg0) {
061                ResourceLocation loc = new imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.DATA.RLOC();
062                ImagePlus testIm = loc.getResource(resourceName).openAsImage();
063                if (testIm == null) {
064                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!"); 
065                        return;
066                }
067                
068                int M = testIm.getNSlices();
069                Overlay oly = new Overlay();
070                
071                // plot the observed image points as circles:
072                Point2D[][] obsPoints = ZhangData.getAllObservedPoints();
073                for (int i = 0; i < obsPoints.length; i++) {
074                        int sliceNo = i + 1;
075                        for (Roi roi : makeCircleRois(obsPoints[i], CircleColor)) {
076                                roi.setPosition(sliceNo);       // associate overly with this slice (important)
077                                oly.add(roi);
078                        }
079                }
080                
081                // plot the projected model points as crosses:
082                Point2D[] modelPoints = ZhangData.getModelPoints();
083                Camera camReal = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
084                ViewTransform[] viewsReal = ZhangData.getAllViewTransforms();
085                
086                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
087                        int sliceNo = i + 1;
088                        Point2D[] projPnts = camReal.project(viewsReal[i], modelPoints);
089                        for (Roi roi : makeCrossRois(projPnts, CrossColor)) {
090                                roi.setPosition(sliceNo);       // associate overly with this slice (important)
091                                oly.add(roi);
092                        }
093                }
094                
095                testIm.setOverlay(oly);
096                testIm.show();  
097        }
098
099        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
100        
101        List<Roi> makeCrossRois(Point2D[] pnts, Color lineCol) {
102                final double r = CrossRadius;
103                final double ofs = 0.5; // pixel offset (elements to be placed at pixel centers)
104                List<Roi> rois = new ArrayList<Roi>();
105                for (int j = 0; j < pnts.length; j++) {
106                        double x = pnts[j].getX();
107                        double y = pnts[j].getY();
108                        Line linX = new Line(x - r + ofs, y + ofs, x + r + ofs, y + ofs);
109                        Line linY = new Line(x + ofs, y - r + ofs, x + ofs, y + r + ofs);
110                        linX.setStrokeColor(lineCol);
111                        linY.setStrokeColor(lineCol);
112                        linX.setStrokeWidth(StrokeWidth);
113                        linY.setStrokeWidth(StrokeWidth);
114                        rois.add(linX);
115                        rois.add(linY);
116                }
117                return rois;
118        }
119        
120        List<Roi> makeCircleRois(Point2D[] pnts, Color lineCol) {
121                final double r = CircleRadius;
122                final double ofs = 0.5; // pixel offset (elements to be placed at pixel centers)
123                List<Roi> rois = new ArrayList<Roi>();
124                for (int j = 0; j < pnts.length; j++) {
125                        double x = pnts[j].getX();
126                        double y = pnts[j].getY();
127                        OvalRoi circle = new OvalRoi(x - r + ofs, y - r + ofs, 2 * r, 2 * r) ;
128                        circle.setStrokeColor(lineCol);
129                        circle.setStrokeWidth(StrokeWidth);
130                        rois.add(circle);
131                }
132                return rois;
133        }
134        
135}
